stance_1: Eating meat three times a day is unhealthy
justification: The belief that eating meat frequently is unhealthy supports the decision to stop eating meat.

stance_1: I cannot fully afford a vegetarian diet
stance_2: I started eating fish due to financial reasons
justification: The inability to afford a vegetarian diet directly supports the decision to start eating fish again for financial reasons.

stance_1: I do not want to participate in animal breeding for consumption
justification: Desire to avoid participating in animal breeding for consumption supports stopping eating meat.

stance_1: I eat salmon twice a month
stance_2: I started eating fish due to financial reasons
justification: The return to eating fish (salmon) is explicitly linked to financial reasons.

stance_1: I feel good not eating mammals
justification: The positive feeling from not eating mammals is a direct result of stopping eating meat.

stance_2: I want to maintain a healthy weight
justification: Stopping eating meat is explicitly motivated by the desire to maintain a healthy weight.

stance_2: I want to prevent health issues
justification: Preventing health issues is an explicit motivation for stopping meat consumption.

stance_1: I started eating fish due to financial reasons
justification: Resuming fish consumption for financial reasons partially conflicts with the stance of stopping eating meat.

stance_1: I want to maintain a healthy weight
stance_2: I want to prevent health issues
justification: Both goals are cited together as motivations for dietary changes, supporting each other.

stance_1: Meat alternatives are available and versatile
justification: Availability of meat alternatives makes it easier to stop eating meat.

stance_1: My family returned to eating meat after leaving home
stance_2: My family stopped eating meat together
justification: Family initially stopped eating meat together, but later some members returned to eating meat, showing a reversal.

stance_1: Eating meat three times a day is unhealthy
stance_2: I want to prevent health issues
justification: Belief that frequent meat eating is unhealthy supports the motivation to prevent health issues.

stance_1: Eating meat three times a day is unhealthy
stance_2: I want to maintain a healthy weight
justification: Belief that frequent meat eating is unhealthy supports the motivation to maintain a healthy weight.
